Name: Linear Programming
Description: Optimization of a linear objective function subject to linear equality and inequality constraints.
Solvability: Polynomial-time solvable using methods like the simplex algorithm or interior-point methods.
Example: Maximize profit given production and resource constraints.

Name: Integer Programming
Description: Optimization where some or all decision variables are constrained to take integer values.
Solvability: NP-hard in general, solved via branch-and-bound, cutting planes, or heuristics.
Example: Scheduling staff shifts to meet constraints.

Name: Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Description: Linear programming where some decision variables are restricted to integers.
Solvability: NP-hard; often solved using commercial solvers with branch-and-bound or branch-and-cut.

Name: Quadratic Programming
Description: Optimization of a quadratic objective function subject to linear constraints.
Solvability: Polynomial-time solvable if convex; NP-hard if non-convex.

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Optimization with a nonlinear objective function or nonlinear constraints.
Solvability: May be solved with iterative methods; global optimality is hard to guarantee.

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: Optimization where the objective and feasible set are convex.

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Breaks down problems into simpler subproblems, solving each only once and storing results.
Solvability: Efficient for problems with overlapping subproblems and optimal substructure.

Name: Stochastic Programming
Description: Optimization that accounts for uncertainty in parameters via probability distributions.
Solvability: Solved with scenario-based or decomposition methods.
Example: Energy generation planning under uncertain demand.

Name: Multi-objective Optimization
Description: Optimization with multiple, often conflicting, objectives.
Solvability: Yields Pareto-optimal solutions; solved with evolutionary algorithms or scalarization.
Example: Trade-off between cost and quality in design.

Name: Combinatorial Optimization
Description: Optimization over a discrete but finite set of feasible solutions.
Solvability: Often NP-hard; solved via exact algorithms or heuristics.
